abstract.text: A structure that describes the types of activities for which the system has built-in support.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
An abstract class that you subclass to implement app-specific services.
A structure that describes the types of activities for which the system has built-in support.
A type of activity that adds the URL to Safariâ€™s reading list.
A type of activity that makes the provided content available through AirDrop.
A type of activity that assigns the image to a contact.
A type of activity that posts the provided content to the pasteboard.
Creates an activity type.
Creates a new instance with the specified raw value.
A type of activity that posts the provided content to a new email message.
A type of activity that marks up the provided content as a PDF file.
A type of activity that posts the provided content to the Messages app.
A type of activity that opens the content in iBooks.
A type of activity that posts the provided content to the userâ€™s wall on Facebook.
A type of activity that posts the provided image to the userâ€™s Flickr account.
A type of activity that posts the provided content to the userâ€™s Tencent Weibo feed.
A type of activity that posts the provided content to the userâ€™s Twitter feed.
A type of activity that posts the provided video to the userâ€™s Vimeo account.
A type of activity that posts the provided content to the userâ€™s Weibo feed.
A type of activity that prints the provided content.
A type of activity that assigns the image or video to the userâ€™s camera roll.
A type of activity that makes the provided content available through SharePlay.
An enumeration that defines categories of activities.
The category of the activity, which may be used to group activities in the UI.
An image that identifies the service to the user.
A user-readable string that describes the service.
The type of service being provided.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.

value.text: A static, plain-text Unicode string object.
